stance_1: I eat poultry most of the time
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of poultry
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that their preference for poultry is based on taste, supporting frequent poultry consumption.

stance_1: I eat poultry most of the time
stance_2: I try to increase protein intake
justification: The interviewee states they are increasing protein intake and poultry is a primary protein source, so these stances support each other.

stance_1: I eat poultry most of the time
stance_2: I value the versatility of poultry
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that poultry's versatility is a reason for eating it often.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of poultry
stance_2: I value the versatility of poultry
justification: The interviewee ties both taste and versatility as the main motivations for choosing poultry.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of poultry
justification: Interviewee and housemates both enjoy poultry, reinforcing each other's preferences.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of poultry
stance_2: My housemates value taste and versatility of chicken
justification: Interviewee and housemates share similar motivations of taste and versatility for choosing poultry.

stance_1: I try to increase protein intake
stance_2: I value the versatility of poultry
justification: Versatility of poultry makes it easier to include in diets aimed at increasing protein, providing implicit support.

stance_2: My housemates value taste and versatility of chicken
justification: Housemates' enjoyment of poultry is explicitly attributed to taste and versatility.

stance_2: We occasionally have meatless meals when busy
justification: Housemates enjoy meat and rarely have meatless meals, only doing so out of necessity, indicating a mild conflict.

stance_1: My housemates value taste and versatility of chicken
stance_2: We occasionally have meatless meals when busy
justification: Preference for taste and versatility of chicken makes meatless meals less desirable, except for convenience, creating an implicit conflict.

stance_1: I eat poultry most of the time
stance_2: We occasionally have meatless meals when busy
justification: Frequent poultry consumption contrasts with only occasional meatless meals, which are not motivated by preference.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of poultry
